name: NOPEC
rateNote: Standard Program: $5.59/Mcf (Jan–May 2026). Anniversary rate $4.99/Mcf for new enrollees (mid-2025). Rates change by contract period — check nopec.org.
coverage: 242 communities across 19 counties in NE Ohio
eligibility: Residential and small commercial in NOPEC member communities
notes: Largest governmental aggregator in Ohio (~1 million accounts). Opt-out program — residents in member communities are automatically enrolled unless they opt out. Serves both Enbridge and Columbia Gas territories. No early termination fee.

name: NOAC
rateNote: Variable rate: NYMEX + $0.3099/Ccf through May 2026 via Archer Energy. Compares favorably to Columbia Gas SCO adder of NYMEX + $0.325.
coverage: Toledo, Perrysburg, Oregon, Northwood, and other NW Ohio communities in Lucas, Wood, and surrounding counties
eligibility: Residential and small commercial in NOAC member communities
notes: Coalition of NW Ohio communities. Gas aggregation rate is variable (NYMEX-plus), not a fixed rate. Contract with Archer Energy runs through mid-2026. Previously managed by Palmer Energy.

name: Stark County
fullName: Stark County Natural Gas Aggregation Program
rateNote: Enbridge customers: $4.65/Mcf. Columbia customers: $0.674/Ccf. Fixed rates through October 2026 billing cycle.
coverage: Stark County unincorporated areas and participating municipalities
eligibility: Residential and small commercial. Voter-approved since 2004.
notes: County-run program since 2004. Serves both Enbridge and Columbia Gas customers at different fixed rates. No early termination fee.

name: Medina County
rateNote: NYMEX Last Day settlement + $3.05/Mcf through April 2026. May 2026–Mar 2027: guaranteed 2% discount off Columbia's SCO adder.
coverage: Medina County communities and unincorporated areas
eligibility: Residential and small commercial in Columbia Gas territory within Medina County
notes: Variable rate program (NYMEX-plus). Archer Energy manages over 150 aggregation programs across Ohio.

name: City of Akron
fullName: City of Akron Natural Gas Aggregation Program
eligibility: Residential and small commercial within Akron city limits (Enbridge territory)
notes: Independent city aggregation program, separate from NOPEC. One of the lower fixed rates available in the state.

name: City of Euclid
fullName: City of Euclid Governmental Aggregation Program
eligibility: Residential and small commercial within Euclid city limits (Enbridge territory)
notes: Two-year contract ending April 2026. Previously used Constellation as supplier.

name: Shaker Heights
fullName: City of Shaker Heights Natural Gas Aggregation Program
eligibility: Residential and small commercial within Shaker Heights
notes: Independent city aggregation. Rate decreasing ~6% starting April 2026.

name: SOPEC
rateNote: Rates vary by member community. Contact SOPEC or check sopec-oh.gov/rates for your community's current rate.
coverage: 38+ communities across SE Ohio (Athens, Gallia, Meigs, Washington, Perry, Hocking, and other Appalachian Ohio counties)
eligibility: Residential and small commercial in SOPEC member communities
notes: Council of governments serving SE Ohio / Appalachian region. Also offers electric aggregation with renewable energy options. Growing — actively adding new member communities. Some communities have gas aggregation on ballot.

name: MVCC
rateNote: Fixed rate of $0.6625/Ccf. Check mvcc.net for current term dates.
coverage: 20 Dayton-area communities including Centerville, Kettering, Miamisburg, Moraine, Oakwood, Springboro, West Carrollton, Germantown
eligibility: Residential and small commercial in MVCC member communities (Columbia Gas territory in Dayton metro)
notes: Coalition of 20 Miami Valley communities. Recently rebranded to MVTCG (Miami Valley Technology and Communications Group). Launched gas aggregation program alongside existing electric program.

name: City of Cincinnati
coverage: City of Cincinnati residents (Duke Energy Ohio territory)
eligibility: Residential and small commercial Duke Energy Ohio customers within Cincinnati city limits
notes: First large city electric aggregation program in Ohio. Also covers natural gas. Duke Energy territory — note Duke uses GCR (moving to SCO April 2026).

name: City of Columbus
rateNote: Electric aggregation focused on 100% clean energy. Natural gas aggregation status unclear — contact the city for details.
eligibility: Residential and small commercial within Columbus city limits
notes: Primarily focused on electric aggregation with clean energy goals. Gas aggregation component may be limited — verify with the city. Managed by Trebel Energy with AEP Energy as supplier.
